com.martinleopold.mode.debug
Class Debugger

java.lang.Object
  com.martinleopold.mode.debug.Debugger
All Implemented Interfaces:
VMEventListener
public class Debugger
extends java.lang.Object
implements VMEventListener

Main controller class for debugging mode. Mainly works with DebugEditor as the corresponding "view". Uses DebugRunner to launch a VM.

Author:
Martin Leopold

Constructor Detail

Debugger

public Debugger(DebugEditor editor)
Construct a Debugger object.

Parameters:
editor - The Editor that will act as primary view
Method Detail

startDebug

public void startDebug()
Start a debugging session. Builds the sketch and launches a VM to run it. VM starts suspended. Should produce a VMStartEvent.

stopDebug

public void stopDebug()
End debugging session. Stops and disconnects VM. Should produce VMDisconnectEvent.

continueDebug

public void continueDebug()
Resume paused debugging session. Resumes VM.

step

protected void step(int stepDepth)
Step through source code lines.

Parameters:
stepDepth - the step depth (StepRequest.STEP_OVER, StepRequest.STEP_INTO or StepRequest.STEP_OUT)

stepOver

public void stepOver()
Step over current statement.

stepInto

public void stepInto()
Step into current statement.

stepOut

public void stepOut()
Step out of current function.

printStackTrace

public void printStackTrace()
Print the current stack trace.

printLocals

public void printLocals()
Print local variables. Outputs type, name and value of each variable.

printThis

public void printThis()
Print fields of current this-object. Outputs type, name and value of each field.

vmEvent

public void vmEvent(com.sun.jdi.event.EventSet es)
Callback for VM events. Will be called from another thread. (VMEventReader)

Specified by:
vmEvent in interface VMEventListener
Parameters:
es - Incoming set of events from VM

isStarted

public boolean isStarted()
Check whether a debugging session is running. i.e. the debugger is connected to a debuggee VM, VMStartEvent has been received and main class is loaded.

Returns:
true if the debugger is started.

isPaused

public boolean isPaused()
Check whether the debugger is paused. i.e. it is currently suspended at a breakpoint or step

Returns:
true if the debugger is paused, false otherwise or if not started (isStarted())

printStackTrace

protected void printStackTrace(com.sun.jdi.ThreadReference t)
Print call stack trace of a thread. Only works on suspended threads.

Parameters:
t - suspended thread to print stack trace of

printLocalVariables

protected void printLocalVariables(com.sun.jdi.ThreadReference t)
Print local variables on a suspended thread. Takes the topmost stack frame and lists all local variables and their values.

Parameters:
t - suspended thread

updateVariableInspector

protected void updateVariableInspector(com.sun.jdi.ThreadReference t)
Update variable inspector window. Displays local variables and this fields.

Parameters:
t - suspended thread to retrieve locals and this

getLocals

protected java.util.List<VariableNode> getLocals(com.sun.jdi.ThreadReference t,
                                                 int depth)
Compile a list of current locals usable for insertion into a JTree. Recursively resolves object references.

Parameters:
t - the suspended thread to get locals for
depth - how deep to resolve nested object references
Returns:
the list of current locals

getThisFields

protected java.util.List<VariableNode> getThisFields(com.sun.jdi.ThreadReference t,
                                                     int depth)
Compile a list of fields in the current this object usable for insertion into a JTree. Recursively resolves object references.

Parameters:
t - the suspended thread to get locals for
depth - how deep to resolve nested object references
Returns:
the list of fields in the current this object

getFieldRecursive

protected VariableNode getFieldRecursive(com.sun.jdi.Field field,
                                         com.sun.jdi.ObjectReference obj,
                                         int depth,
                                         int maxDepth)
Recursively resolve a field for use in a JTree. Uses an object reference as environment. Used by getLocals(com.sun.jdi.ThreadReference, int) and getThisFields(com.sun.jdi.ThreadReference, int).

Parameters:
field - the field to resolve
obj - the object reference used as environment (must contain the field to resolve)
depth - the current depth (in the recursive call)
maxDepth - the depth to stop recursion at
Returns:
the resolved field

getStackTrace

protected java.util.List<javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode> getStackTrace(com.sun.jdi.ThreadReference t)
Get the current call stack trace usable for insertion into a JTree.

Parameters:
t - the suspended thread to retrieve the call stack from
Returns:
call stack as list of DefaultMutableTreeNodes

printThis

protected void printThis(com.sun.jdi.ThreadReference t)
Print visible fields of current "this" object on a suspended thread. Prints type, name and value.

Parameters:
t - suspended thread

printSourceLocation

protected void printSourceLocation(com.sun.jdi.ThreadReference t)
Print source code snippet of current location in a suspended thread.

Parameters:
t - suspended thread

Print source code snippet.

Parameters:
l - Location object to print source code for

getSourceLine

protected java.lang.String getSourceLine(java.lang.String filePath,
                                         int lineNo,
                                         int radius)
Read a line from the given file in the builds src folder. 1-based i.e. first line has line no. 1

Parameters:
filePath -
lineNo -
Returns:
the requested source line

printType

protected void printType(com.sun.jdi.ReferenceType rt)
Print info about a ReferenceType. Prints class name, source file name, lists methods.

Parameters:
rt - the reference type to print out

selectSourceLocation

protected void selectSourceLocation(com.sun.jdi.Location l)
Mark a line in the editor by selecting it. Switches to appropriate tab.

Parameters:
l - Location object that describes source location to select.

highlightLine

protected void highlightLine(com.sun.jdi.Location l)
Highlight a source line in the editor. Used for highlighting the current line when suspended.

Parameters:
l - the location to highlight.

clearHighlight

protected void clearHighlight()
Clear the highlight set with highlightLine(com.sun.jdi.Location).

setBreakpoint

protected void setBreakpoint(LineID sketchLine)
Set a breakpoint on a sketch line.

Parameters:
sketchLine - specifies the line to set the breakpoint on

removeBreakpoint

protected void removeBreakpoint(LineID sketchLine)
Remove a breakpoint from a sketch line. Deletes the breakpoint request from the event request manager.

Parameters:
sketchLine - identifies the line to remove the breakpoint from
